result.execSummary:
The defendant Diego Amando Sanchez Medina was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 14CF252 and 14CM270 called at 3:01pm.  Clerk - CRHI.
Defendant Diego Amando Sanchez Medina in court with attorney Erik I. Colque.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rick Kissell sworn as Spanish Interpreter for the Defendant.
Recommendations presented by Counsel. 
Statement presented by the defendant. 
The Court orders:
14CF252 - Count #1 as amended and Count #2:
The Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on probation for  2 years on each count concurrent with conditions:  The defendant has 3 days credit for time served. (For the time period of 7/25/14 through 7/28/14.) 
CONDITION:
-  $243 costs on each count
-  $200 DNA surcharge on each count
-  $132 subpoena fees
-  Count #1 ONLY - 60 days jail with work release for employment, treatment and counseling commencing forthwith. The Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence and/or sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of huber/work release without further process.
-  Certified Batterer's Treatment and Intervention Programming
-  No acts or threats of violence towards any person. 
-  Any other assessment, treatment, counsel or therapies per the Agent. 
-  Completion of Incredible Years Parenting Class or a similiar parenting class as directed by the Agent. 
-  No contact with Randy Gomez Garcia. 

14CM270 - Count #2:
The Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on probation for  2 years with conditions:  The defendant has 3 days credit for time served. (For the time period of 7/25/14 through 7/28/14.) 
CONDITION:
-  $243 costs  - Bond posted to be applied)
-  $200 DNA surcharge 
-  $20 subpoena fees
-  $100 domestic abuse surcharge
-  Certified Batterer's Treatment and Intervention Programming
-  No acts or threats of violence towards any person. 
-  Any other assessment, treatment, counsel or therapies per the Agent. 
-  Completion of Incredible Years Parenting Class or a similiar parenting class as directed by the Agent. 
-  No contact with Randy Gomez Garcia. 
Recess 3:26pm.
Sentencing hearing on January 27, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
With criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Cases 14CF252 & 14CM270 called together at 1:38 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC)
Defendant Diego Amando Sanchez Medina in court with Attorney Erik I. Colque. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sylvie Dahnert sworn as Spanish Interpreter.
On Motion of the State, the Court amends Count #1 to Battery, a Class A misdemeanor, contrary to 940.19(1)-14CF252
Upon request of Atty Colque the Court amends Plea questionnaire by Its own hand to reflect the correct statute for Class A misdemeanor battery

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on 14CM270 & Counts #1 (as amended) & #2-14CF252; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
Atty Colque requests sentencing at later date; ADA Teuber: No objection
Court informs parties that if sentencing is adjourned and a jail sentence is imposed, it is likely the jail sentence will begin forthwith following sentencing
Court reminds Mr. Sanchez Medina that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect in each case while cases are pending
Recess: 1:53 pm

NEXT: BOTH CASES (1) Schedule Sentencing Hearing 1/27/15 at 2:00 pm (30 minutes) - Send notices
Final status/scheduling conference on January 8, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Cases 14CF252 & 14CM270 called together at 1:34 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Diego Amando Sanchez Medina in court with Attorney Erik I. Colque. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Elizabeth Barrera sworn as Spanish Interpreter.
Atty Colque submits Motions in Limine & Proposed Jury Instructions on each case and informs the court that matters will continue to trial. Client is undecided on updated offer and has asked to proceed with trial.
Court explains that today's date is usually last date for the Defendant to enter a plea in matters; offers more time to think of offer and can adjourn matter a day or two if needed
off-record: 1:37 - 1:38 pm for Atty Colque to consult with client
Atty Colque requests matter be reset later this week
DA Happ: No objection to adjourning, but checking with ADA Teuber as offer indicates that it is only good until today's date
off-record: 1:40 - 1:45 pm to discuss scheduling
Court announces adjourned FSSC date for the record and informs parties that JTs remain on the calendar and no witnesses should be canceled
Upon questioning of the Court, Counsel agree they can proceed with motions today & that if cases go to trial, the felony should proceed
Upon questioning of the Court, DA Happ confirms that motions should be applied to both cases even though they have only been filed in felony
Court grants and indicates that Its orders will also apply to the misdemeanor case

Counsel agree a Miranda Goodchild Hearing is not needed

On State's Motion to Impeach the Defendant
No objection by Defense; Court grants motion & finds that Mr. Sanchez Medina has 2 prior convictions for impeachment purposes
Court reviews with Mr. Sanchez Medina his right to/not to testify

On State's Motions in Limine:
Atty Colque indicates that he objects to #11; Arguments presented. Court grants subject to the Court having custodian or other qualified person present at trial
Court grants Motions in Limine with clarification to #11 

Court informs parties that It will be given until the final jury instruction for standard objections to proposed instructions, but today is deadline for special instructions

On Defense Motions in Limine:
Counsel discuss Paragraph 12; Court informs parties that It will follow normal procedure re: introduction of witnesses
Counsel discuss Paragraph 13; Court informs parties that It supplies Jury with complete set of written instructions
Court grants Defense Motions in Limine with clarifications on #12 & 13

5 strikes each; 1 alternate; 23 in the box
Jurors make take notes & ask questions
Court informs parties that It will not decide which day the cases would proceed to trial
Recess: 2:05 pm 

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) Notices given in Court - Rescheduled Final status/scheduling conference scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 01:15 pm
State's Notice of Intent to Admit Statements Made by the Defendant.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Impeach the Def. with priors.
Jury trial on January 12/13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on January 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Cases 14CF252 & 14CM270 called together at 1:26 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Diego Amando Sanchez Medina in court with Attorney Erik I. Colque. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter.

14CF252:
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Sanchez Medina waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Atty Colque requests matter be set for FSSC & JT 
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 1:33 pm

NEXT:  BOTH CASES: (1) FSSC scheduled for 1/6/15 at 1:30 pm - Send notices (2) JT scheduled for 1/12-13/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on October 24, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 8, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Cases 14CF252 & 14CM270 called together at 2:00 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Diego Amando Sanchez Medina in court with Attorney Erik I. Colque. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter.
Atty Colque: There has not yet been DA PTC, requests matter be set for DA PTC and STC. 
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Colque indicates that the Defendant failed to appear for last scheduled DA PTC, but retained him the same date
ADA Hall informs the Court that there has been no bail violation
Court continues bond and informs Mr. Sanchez Medina that he must appear at the 10/24/14 STC otherwise a warrant will be issued for his arrest
Recess: 2:03 pm 

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) Schedule DA PTC 10/8/14 at 11:00 am - Send notices (2) Schedule STC 10/24/14 at 1:15  pm - Send notices
Status conference on September 5, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Court ok's request to reschedule 8/29/14 status, if DA agrees & victim rights  complaince
Copy of Atty Colques's Letc. submitted by the State indicating: the state has no objections to the request to reschedule
Letter from Attorney Colque requesting the Status hearing set for 08-29-14 be rescheduled
Status conference on August 29, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 13, 2014 at 10:40 am.

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
Conflict review worksheet

ADDRESS INFO for Diego Amando Sanchez Medina
Current: 1221 Sherwood Ln. Apt 8, Jefferson, WI 53549   (Effective: 07-28-2014)
Prior: 1221 Sherwood Ln. Apt 4, Jefferson, WI 53549

Cases 14CF252 & 14CM270 called at 
Defendant Diego Amando Sanchez Medina in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Shawna Stevenoski sworn in as Spanish Interpreter.
Attorney De La Rosa informs the Court that it will depend on what type of bond is ordered whether or not the Defendant will qualify for SPD representation.
Court reviews conflict review worksheet, finds no conflict and signs the worksheet.

On case 14CM270:
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant or Speedy Trial Demand by Defense.

On case 14CF252:
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause to support Count #1 & #2.
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Court will not take pleas in remaining misdemeanor counts and will track them with the felony count.

Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB listed on the criminal complaints are correct.
Defendant provides updated address to the Court.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court continues the $150 CASH bond to cover 14CM270, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence towards anyone
-No contact with Alma Hernandez Cervantes

Court requires $5,000.00 signature bond to cover 14CF252, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence towards anyone
-No contact with Alma Hernandez Cervantes or their two minor children
-No contact with Randy Gomez Garcia

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given

Recess: 1:43 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 8/13/14 at 10:40 am
Status: 8/29/14 at 10:30 am

(****JA - PLEASE NOTE: Court will not take pleas in remaining misdemeanor counts and will track them with the felony count.***)
